III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS & CONCLUSIONS
A. Physical Description of Facility
Boys Hope/Girls Hope is a large colonial residential home within the Sherwood Forest
Historical District on the city’s west side. Per the fire safety compliance report, Boys
Hope/Girls Hope is being licensed as a residential group home facility. Boys Hope/Girls
Hope received an “A” rating for the fire safety inspection on 08/04/2016 and an “A”
rating for the environmental health inspection on 04/14/2016. The main foyer leads to a
stairway to the upstairs, as well as the main floor living area with fireplace. Further into
the home is a formal dining room with an open kitchen next to it. A center hallway leads
to the back of the home where a small staff office is located and across from it bedroom
#1 with one twin bed. Next to bedroom #1 is bathroom that contains a full size bath tub,
separate shower, standard toilet, and sink. The back of the home contains bedroom #2,
with a half bath, and two twin beds. Bedroom #3 is also in the back of the home with
one twin bed and intended to be a live-in staff person’s residence. Bedroom #3 also
contains an exterior door. Bedroom #3 is approved as a staff member’s residence as
long as the door leading into bedroom #3 cannot be locked and must remain readily
accessible at all times, per the qualified fire inspector.
The stairway leading to the upstairs enters into a spacious living area. Attached to the
living area is a step down area with fireplace that contains a large conference table and
is intended as a study area. In the corner of the study area is a small storage closet
that also leads to an extremely small bay window room perched above the homes main
entrance. Across from the upstairs living area and next to the stairway contains
bedroom #4 with one twin bed. On the same side of the hallway is a small room that
will be used as storage or staff office. Across the hall is bedroom #5 with one twin bed.
Next to bedroom #5 is a bathroom that contains a full size tub, separate shower,
standard toilet and sink. The back of the home on the upstairs contains bedroom #6,
with a half bath, and two twin beds. On the opposite side of bedroom #6 is a small
study/library area that contains an exterior door leading to a fire escape. The
study/library area does not contain an interior door and will not be used as a bedroom.
The kitchen contains a stairway that leads to a side exterior door, as well as to the
basement. A large recreation room with glass block windows is near the base of the
stairway and an approved room for youth to occupy, per the qualified fire inspector.
2

Also near the base of the stairway is the furnace room, which contains the furnace, two
hot water heaters and a fire suppression system. The room is free of debris. The
basement also contains a large room that contains a washer and dryer, a half bath, and
four storage rooms.
The backyard contains a one car garage and a small backyard area. The back of the
home contains the attached fire escape stairway leading to the second floor.
The home is clean and well decorated. Bedrooms contain ample closet and storage for
the youth.
B. Program Description
Boys Hope/Girls Hope is a privately funded, non-DHHS contracted, residential facility. It
will service a maximum of six female residents, between the ages of 12 and 17 years
old. The facility places academically capable and motivated youth-in-need within a
value-centered, family-like home, to provide opportunities and education through their
college placement. Boys Hope/Girls Hope will provide educational support and
enrichment activities through their onsite residential counselors. Youth will also receive
preventive and emergency medical and dental care and referrals to other community
resources and specialists as needed. Youth will be taught daily living skills to include
personal care, housekeeping, interpersonal skill building and receive a multitude of
social activities. Boys Hope/Girls Hope staff are trained within Therapeutic Crisis
Intervention though will not perform restraints. Disciplinary tools utilized by Boys
Hope/Girls Hope will include positive reinforcement, natural consequences, and the loss
of privileges.
Medications are stored in a locked cabinet within the locked staff office on the main floor
of the site, which only staff has access. Resident records are stored in a locked file
cabinet within the facility’s administrative office in the Fischer Theatre building. The
facility’s policies and procedures have been reviewed and have been found to be in
compliance with State of Michigan licensing rules and applicable statutes.
C. Rule/Statutory Violations
There are no rule/statutory violations. Boys Hope/Girls Hope meets licensing
requirements to open.
3

IV. RECOMMENDATION
The issuance of a provisional license to this private child caring institution is
recommended.
